name: Sounds unreal
description: A history of syncing sound effects, a craft known as Foley in the USA and bootstepping in the UK.

end.title: Spartacus
end.creator_credit: James C. Katz, Edward Lewis and Bill Thomas
end.brief_description: The rebellious Thracian Spartacus, born and raised a slave, is sold to Gladiator trainer Batiatus. After weeks of being trained to kill for the arena, Spartacus turns on his owners and leads the other slaves in rebellion.

constellations_other.name: Sounds unreal
constellations_other.description: A history of syncing sound effects, a craft known as Foley in the USA and bootstepping in the UK.

links.description: The art of Foley is named after Jack Foley, who started out making live sound effects for radio. He later transferred his audio trickery to films, including on Spartacus, where he created the sound of an army on horseback using a set of keys.

start.title: Funny Business
start.brief_description: Funny Business is a documentary-style television series about the craft of comedy consisting of six 50-minute episodes.

constellations_other.name: Sounds unreal
constellations_other.description: A history of syncing sound effects, a craft known as Foley in the USA and bootstepping in the UK.

end.title: Berberian Sound Studio
end.creator_credit: Keith Griffiths, Mary Burke, Warp X and IFC Midnight

video_links.name: Berberian Sound Studio official trailer - in cinemas from 31 August 2012

end.brief_description: In the 1970s, a British sound technician is brought to Italy to work on the sound effects for a gruesome horror film. His nightmarish task slowly takes over his psyche, driving him to confront his own past.

constellations_other.name: Sounds unreal
constellations_other.description: A history of syncing sound effects, a craft known as Foley in the USA and bootstepping in the UK.

links.description: Rowan Atkinson’s documentary on slapstick includes a sequence demonstrating how hitting different fruits can produce different sounds for punching. One, a watermelon, is also used by Toby Jones’ character in the 2012 horror/thriller about a Foley artist, Berberian Sound Studio

start.title: Funny Business
start.brief_description: Funny Business is a documentary-style television series about the craft of comedy consisting of six 50-minute episodes.

constellations_other.name: Sounds unreal
constellations_other.description: A history of syncing sound effects, a craft known as Foley in the USA and bootstepping in the UK.

end.title: PlayTime
end.creator_credit: Bernard Maurice, Jacques Tati, Jacques Lagrange, Jacques Cottin and Art Buchwald
end.brief_description: He attempts to meet with a business contact but soon becomes lost.

constellations_other.name: Sounds unreal
constellations_other.description: A history of syncing sound effects, a craft known as Foley in the USA and bootstepping in the UK.

links.description: Rowan Atkinson’s physical comedy was enormously influenced by Jacques Tati, and Atkinson includes a number of Tati clips in his documentary on slapstick Funny Business.

video_links.name: Berberian Sound Studio official trailer - in cinemas from 31 August 2012

start.brief_description: In the 1970s, a British sound technician is brought to Italy to work on the sound effects for a gruesome horror film. His nightmarish task slowly takes over his psyche, driving him to confront his own past.

constellations_other.description: A history of syncing sound effects, a craft known as Foley in the USA and bootstepping in the UK.

end.title: Spartacus
end.creator_credit: James C. Katz, Edward Lewis and Bill Thomas
end.brief_description: The rebellious Thracian Spartacus, born and raised a slave, is sold to Gladiator trainer Batiatus. After weeks of being trained to kill for the arena, Spartacus turns on his owners and leads the other slaves in rebellion.

constellations_other.name: Sounds unreal
constellations_other.description: A history of syncing sound effects, a craft known as Foley in the USA and bootstepping in the UK.

links.description: In the middle of the century, Foley artists were in-demand experts travelling from studio to studio, like Toby Fox’s character in the film Berberian Sound Studio.

start.title: Spartacus
start.creator_credit: James C. Katz, Edward Lewis and Bill Thomas
start.brief_description: The rebellious Thracian Spartacus, born and raised a slave, is sold to Gladiator trainer Batiatus. After weeks of being trained to kill for the arena, Spartacus turns on his owners and leads the other slaves in rebellion.

end.title: Star Wars
end.creator_credit: Rick McCallum, Gary Kurtz, Lucasfilm Ltd. and Paul Huston

video_links.name: Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope - Trailer

end.brief_description: George Lucas’ blockbuster space opera that helped usher in the modern era of movies features instantly iconic characters from Luke Skywalker and Han Solo to Princess Leia and Darth Vader.

constellations_other.name: Expansive light in science fiction and fantasy
constellations_other.description: Visual artists have identified the importance of light in revealing the expansiveness of our universe. Explore how artists’ perception of light has been adapted and referenced in science fiction and fantasy on screen.

constellations_other.name: Sounds unreal
constellations_other.description: A history of syncing sound effects, a craft known as Foley in the USA and bootstepping in the UK.

constellations_other.name: Sound and cinema
constellations_other.description: Beginning with one of the first films to be screened at the Palais (a Melbourne cinema with its own outstanding resident orchestra) the constellation celebrates sound as an integral part of the connection between moving image work and audience.

constellations_other.name: Innovation, technology and design: Edweard Muybridge
constellations_other.description: A focus on the discovery, inspiration and innovation at the heart of moving image history

constellations_other.name: Found footage and the first camcorder
constellations_other.description: Amateur filmmakers turned the camera on their own lives when camcorders like the Sony Betamovie BMC-100P came on the market. The style of footage filmed on camcorders has inspired many fictional films, particularly in the horror genre.

constellations_other.name: One of the first auteurs
constellations_other.description: A progenitor of modern film genres such as sci-fi, psychological thriller and serial killer films decades before such terms were coined, Austrian-born director Fritz Lang also enjoyed the occasional on-screen meta-moment.

links.description: Foley artists on classic films like Spartacus were never credited, making it hard to trace a history of the craft. One of the first people to be credited for making sound effects for a film is Benjamin Burtt Jr for Star Wars, but it would be decades before all Foley artists were regularly credited for their work.

start.title: Star Wars
start.creator_credit: Rick McCallum, Gary Kurtz, Lucasfilm Ltd. and Paul Huston

video_links.name: Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope - Trailer

constellations_other.description: A progenitor of modern film genres such as sci-fi, psychological thriller and serial killer films decades before such terms were coined, Austrian-born director Fritz Lang also enjoyed the occasional on-screen meta-moment.

end.title: Star Wars: The Last Jedi
end.creator_credit: Kathleen Kennedy, Andres Jauernick, Leifur B. Dagfinnsson, Ram Bergman and Lucasfilm Ltd.
end.brief_description: Rey develops her newly discovered abilities with the guidance of Luke Skywalker, who is unsettled by the strength of her powers. Meanwhile, the Resistance prepares to do battle with the First Order.

constellations_other.name: Sounds unreal
constellations_other.description: A history of syncing sound effects, a craft known as Foley in the USA and bootstepping in the UK.

links.description: The sound of laser blasters in Star Wars is so iconic that many Star Wars cast members now have difficulty not making ‘pew pew’ noises themselves while filming. In fact, Laura Dern can be seen in the finished cut of The Last Jedi mouthing ‘pew’ while firing her blaster.

constellations_primary.name: Sounds unreal
constellations_primary.description: A history of syncing sound effects, a craft known as Foley in the USA and bootstepping in the UK.

end.title: 2001: A Space Odyssey
end.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1968
end.brief_description: Humanity finds a mysterious object buried beneath the lunar surface and sets off to find its origins with the help of HAL 9000, the world’s most advanced super computer, in Stanley Kubrick’s masterpiece, which pushed cinematic narratives and special effects.

constellations_other.name: Space, sci-fi and cinema fakes
constellations_other.description: Magic lantern slides were used to entertain and educate audiences in home, theatres and universities. While performers told jokes and fairytales, travelling showmen unveiled exotic locations and scientists revealed the latest discoveries.

constellations_other.name: Sounds unreal
constellations_other.description: A history of syncing sound effects, a craft known as Foley in the USA and bootstepping in the UK.

constellations_other.name: Future visions
constellations_other.description: Entities is a time-based data visualisation of visitors collecting objects and exploring Constellations. These actions are translated into graphical forms to show what’s being collected, as well as highlighting Constellations that share connections.

constellations_other.name: Kaleidoscopic colour: Chromotrope
constellations_other.description: A focus on distinctive and innovative examples of pattern, colour and movement.

constellations_other.name: Auteurs, influence and inspiration
constellations_other.description: A tradition of influence and inspiration beginning with Eisenstein.

constellations_other.name: The Kubrick connection
constellations_other.description: The visual effects for Blade Runner drew on a number of techniques from other iconic films, including two of Stanley Kubrick's masterpieces.

constellations_other.name: Evil AI, dystopias and production design
constellations_other.description: In No Code’s sci-fi thriller players take command of a multi-national space station’s artificial intelligence system to help the sole survivor solve the mystery of a missing crew and why the station is wildly off course.

constellations_other.name: Sublime light and special effects
constellations_other.description: Explore 19th-century artist John Martin’s surprising influence on science fiction and fantasy films of the 20th century, from Jason and the Argonauts to the Lord of the Rings and the Evil Dead franchises.

links.description: Tacita Dean’s installation artwork features the work of sound effects creator Beryl Mortimer, known in the industry as ‘Beryl The Boot’ for her ability to mimic footsteps. Although she is regarded as a legend of the field, most of her work (including her iconic work on 2001: A Space Odyssey) went uncredited.

end.title: PlayTime
end.creator_credit: Bernard Maurice, Jacques Tati, Jacques Lagrange, Jacques Cottin and Art Buchwald
end.brief_description: He attempts to meet with a business contact but soon becomes lost.

constellations_other.name: Sounds unreal
constellations_other.description: A history of syncing sound effects, a craft known as Foley in the USA and bootstepping in the UK.

links.description: Stanley Kubrick’s 2001 and Jacques Tati’s Playtime were both captured on 70mm film, which in addition to creating a spectacular image, gave more space on the filmstrip for the soundtrack, allowing them to include richer and fuller soundscape.
